intro: Macrostylis vernalis, commonly known as the spring bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowering period coincides with the vernal season, making it a symbol of the arrival of spring in many regions. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
